author: williamofthesun
title: One Book a Month

assessments.note: The idea is interesting more information is required to understand the challenge presented and its relevance to the Cardano mission at large.
An understandable challenge question hasn't been presented and it is unclear how the challenge is aligned with Cardano's mission
I like the idea, but I think it is allocated in the wrong category.
I dont think this is critical to achive Cardanos overall mission

Nice idea, but I cannot see this as a Challenge Setting for the community, this is more a proposal for an activity of an individual, the author. I do not see that this is in any way critical to achieve CARDANO's mission at this early stage. Nevertheless, from art-perspective, this is certainly a charming idea.
Although a noble cause, that is reading. I don't feel it as a pressing matter for the evolution of Cardano. Maybe not even secondary. Also the idea is a little bit confusing and could be worked on.

Here is the framework for how I estimate the level of IMPACT for the new Challenge for Fund6:
1) Is this a wicked problem that has not been addressed in previous challenges?

This seems more like a proposal than a challenge. It is very narrow.

2) Is this addressing a "green pasture" opportunity that could improve the well-being across a major region or globally?

See previous comment. Does not seem suitable as a challenge.

3) How much will the requested funds catalyze this effort and produce a meaningful result over the next few years?

The scope of the challenge and funds requested do not seem like they would inspire much community effort.
I require more information to assess this criteria.
This challenge is not feasible, as there is not enough description to understand what it is proposed for.

As it stands right now, I do not see it feasible for a community to invest 30000 USD to write a book like this.
There is no insight for the cost. Are we talking about printed books? How many pages? Hardcover or paperback? Will it be an e-book? Will you write it yourself or will a team be involved for this?

You could increase your chances by addressing this as a learning opportunity to learn about the workings of a stake pool node.
I think the community has the ability to adress the challenge, but i dont agree that the challenge is on par with Cardanos mission

Well, for me it is still rather unclear, what the role of the community would be ? Reading and distributing the books ? Written on a typewriter, I suppose that these would be 'physical books'? Can they become subject of an NFT-based art gallery, subject to art-collections ? I have to admit that I do not fully understand this idea yet, but with this NFT art-collection potential I could see some benefit and something the community is able to do.
Not sure if everyone has the spirit of an artist or a writer. It can be cultivated yes, but to what extent do we have in our community interest to fulfill this request?
Normally, I have a rubric to work through these proposals, but this challenge is so narrow in focus that I think it does not meet the minimum bar for a community challenge or further assessment.
A clear roadmap how can the solution to the challenge can be implemented and how the proposer details the steps required to get there.

The verifiability of the challenge doesn't apply, as it is not clear that the proposed idea is a challenge, according to what is established in the Catalyst documentation and in the Town Hall presentations.

The information included in this proposal is not sufficient to audit it correctly. You will need to add a lot more to have people understand what exactly you are trying to do. As I said, I like the idea, but it needs to be proposed in the correct challenge and needs way more elaboration.
i have no words to describe what i feel about this proposal , someone had some time to waste so he decide to waste other people times ...
I didnt fully understand your challenge suggestion and how it can help Cardano overall.

I understand it as following: A thin book stands for a fast-saturating stake-pool, a thick one is accumulated, if it takes longer. This way, the interested community could be motivated to close a book and re-delegate to a non-saturated pool ? Hmm, I think that is a nice extra motivation, but the main motivation for moving to non-saturated pools will probably still be the potential optimization of rewards. Again, charming idea from art-perspective, but for me still lacking also clear metrics of success (could be the establishment of Cardano-related NFT-based art gallery, number of members, etc.)
It is an interesting challenge, but I think it totally misses the mark of the objective of this fund challenge setting.
Normally, I have a rubric to work through these proposals, but this challenge is so narrow in focus it is hard to assess how impactful the funds requested would be

importance: The typewriting process emulates the purpose of a decentralized network, in that each page is like a block on the chain.
success: Success is saturating a stake pool and releasing literature relating to the human condition.
